content: TITLE: Importing Share Buttons from React Share DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to import various social media share button components from the react-share library. These components can be used to integrate sharing functionality for platforms like Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and many others. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { EmailShareButton, FacebookShareButton, GabShareButton, HatenaShareButton, InstapaperShareButton, LineShareButton, LinkedinShareButton, LivejournalShareButton, MailruShareButton, OKShareButton, PinterestShareButton, PocketShareButton, RedditShareButton, TelegramShareButton, ThreadsShareButton, TumblrShareButton, TwitterShareButton, ViberShareButton, VKShareButton, WhatsappShareButton, WorkplaceShareButton, } from "react-share"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing React Share Package via npm DESCRIPTION: Command to install the react-share package using npm package manager. This is the first step to integrate social media sharing capabilities into a React application. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install react-share ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using FacebookShareCount Component in React JSX DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the FacebookShareCount component in a React component. It takes a 'url' prop which is the URL being shared, and optionally a 'className' prop for styling. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Rendering of Share Count in React JSX DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to customize the rendering of a share count component. It uses a function as a child component that receives the shareCount as an argument and returns a custom element. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` {(shareCount) => {shareCount}} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Social Media Icons in React DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to import various social media icon components from the react-share library. These icons can be used alongside the share buttons to create a complete sharing interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { EmailIcon, FacebookIcon, FacebookMessengerIcon, GabIcon, HatenaIcon, InstapaperIcon, LineIcon, LinkedinIcon, LivejournalIcon, MailruIcon, OKIcon, PinterestIcon, PocketIcon, RedditIcon, TelegramIcon, ThreadsIcon, TumblrIcon, TwitterIcon, ViberIcon, VKIcon, WeiboIcon, WhatsappIcon, WorkplaceIcon, XIcon, BlueskyIcon, } from "react-share"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Share Count Components in React DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import various share count components from the react-share library. These components can be used to display the number of times a URL has been shared on different social media platforms. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { FacebookShareCount, HatenaShareCount, OKShareCount, PinterestShareCount, RedditShareCount, TumblrShareCount, VKShareCount, } from "react-share"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using TwitterIcon Component in React JSX DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the TwitterIcon component with custom props. It sets the size to 32 pixels and makes the icon round. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Share Buttons Migration DESCRIPTION: Shows the change in import syntax for share buttons from v1's ShareButtons namespace to v2's direct imports. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/docs/migrate-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { ShareButtons } from 'react-share'; const { FacebookShareButton, TwitterShareButton, } = ShareButtons; ``` LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { FacebookShareButton, TwitterShareButton, } from 'react-share'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Share Icons Migration DESCRIPTION: Shows the change from v1's generateShareIcon function to v2's direct icon component imports. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/docs/migrate-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { generateShareIcon } from 'react-share'; const FacebookIcon = generateShareIcon('facebook'); ``` LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { FacebookIcon } from 'react-share'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Share Counts Migration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the migration from v1's ShareCounts namespace to v2's direct imports for share count components. SOURCE: https://github.com/nygardk/react-share/blob/master/docs/migrate-v1-to-v2.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { ShareCounts } from 'react-share'; const { FacebookShareCount, GooglePlusShareCount, } = ShareCounts; ``` LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { FacebookShareCount, GooglePlusShareCount, } from 'react-share'; ```
